name: Data Journalism
description: The use of data analysis techniques to produce and report news stories

name: Investigative Journalism
description: In-depth reporting that uncovers scandals, corruption, and other societal issues

name: Multimedia Journalism
description: The use of different media formats such as text, images, video, and audio to tell news stories

name: Photojournalism
description: The use of photographs to tell news stories

name: Science Journalism
description: The reporting of scientific news and research findings

name: Sports Journalism
description: The reporting of news and events in the world of sports

name: War Journalism
description: The reporting of conflicts, wars, and related events and issues

name: Business Journalism
description: The reporting of news and analysis related to business and finance

name: Environmental Journalism
description: The reporting of news and analysis related to the environment, conservation, and sustainability

name: Opinion Journalism
description: The expression of personal opinions and perspectives on current events and issues

name: Political Journalism
description: The reporting of news and analysis related to politics and government

name: Entertainment Journalism
description: The reporting of news and analysis related to the entertainment industry, including movies, music, and television

name: International Journalism
description: The reporting of news and analysis related to events and issues in other countries and regions

name: Community Journalism
description: The reporting of news and events in a specific community or locality

name: Media Theory
description: Studies of the nature of media, how media is created and consumed, and the impact of media on society

name: Media Criticism
description: Analysis and evaluation of media content, including news, advertising, film, and television

name: Media History
description: Study of the historical development of media technologies and their impact on society

name: Media Ethics
description: Examination of the ethical considerations and responsibilities of media professionals

name: Media Effects
description: Study of the psychological and social effects of media on individuals and society

name: Media Production
description: Practical skills and techniques involved in producing media content, such as film, television, radio, and digital media

name: Media Management
description: Study of the business aspects of media, including marketing, finance, and organizational structure

name: Digital Media
description: Exploration of the creation and consumption of media in digital formats, including online content, social media, and video games

name: Advertising
description: Study of the principles and practices of advertising, including media planning, creative development, and audience targeting

name: Public Relations
description: Study of the principles and practices of public relations, including media relations, crisis management, and reputation management.

name: American Politics
description: Study of American political institutions and behavior, including the presidency, Congress, political parties, elections, public opinion, and political culture.

name: Comparative Politics
description: Comparative study of political systems and institutions across different countries and regions, including democratization, authoritarianism, and political economy.

name: International Relations
description: Study of interactions between nation-states and non-state actors, including diplomacy, foreign policy, security studies, international law, and global governance.

name: Political Theory
description: Exploration of political concepts and ideas, including democracy, justice, liberty, equality, and human rights.

name: Public Administration
description: Study of the organization, management, and implementation of public policies and programs, including bureaucracy, public management, and public policy analysis.

name: Public Law
description: Study of the role of law in politics and society, including constitutional law, administrative law, and the relationship between law and politics.

name: Public Opinion
description: Analysis of the attitudes and beliefs of the general public toward politics and public policy, including surveys, polling, and statistical analysis.

name: Public Policy
description: Study of the processes by which government decisions are made and implemented, including policy analysis, program evaluation, and policy implementation.

name: Political Methodology
description: Development and application of quantitative and qualitative research methods to the study of politics and political phenomena.

name: Political Economy
description: Study of the interplay between politics and economics, including issues such as economic development, inequality, and regulation.

name: Social Stratification
description: Studies how individuals and groups are positioned within a social hierarchy, and how this affects their life chances and opportunities.

name: Sociology of Culture
description: Explores the social meanings and practices of cultural phenomena such as art, music, literature, fashion, and media.

name: Sociology of Education
description: Examines the social structures and processes that shape education, including school systems, curriculum, pedagogy, and student outcomes.

name: Sociology of Health and Illness
description: Investigates the social factors that influence health, illness, and healthcare, including access to resources, social support, and cultural beliefs.

name: Sociology of Law
description: Explores how law is created, enforced, and contested within society, and how legal institutions shape social relations and norms.

name: Sociology of Religion
description: Examines the role of religion in society, including its impact on social values, identity, and behavior.

name: Sociology of Science and Technology
description: Studies the social and cultural factors that shape scientific and technological innovation, including the role of social institutions and actors in the development of science and technology.

name: Environmental Sociology
description: Examines the social and cultural dimensions of environmental problems and their solutions, including the role of social institutions, policies, and social movements in shaping environmental outcomes.

name: Economic Sociology
description: Studies how social structures and processes influence economic behavior and outcomes, including the distribution of resources, economic institutions, and the role of markets in society.

name: Political Sociology
description: Examines the relationship between social structures and political processes, including the role of power, institutions, and social movements in shaping political outcomes.

name: Sociology of Migration
description: Investigates the social and cultural dimensions of migration, including the causes and consequences of migration, and the social and cultural factors that shape the experiences of migrants and their reception in host societies.

name: Microeconomics
description: Focuses on individual economic agents such as consumers, producers, and markets

name: Macroeconomics
description: Studies the behavior of the economy as a whole, including economic growth, inflation, and unemployment

name: Econometrics
description: Applies statistical and mathematical methods to analyze economic data and test economic theories

name: Development Economics
description: Studies the economic development of countries and regions, and the factors that contribute to or hinder economic growth

name: International Economics
description: Examines the economic interactions between countries, including trade, finance, and migration

name: Public Economics
description: Analyzes the role of government in the economy, including taxation, public goods, and welfare programs

name: Environmental Economics
description: Studies the interactions between the economy and the environment, including issues related to pollution, natural resources, and climate change

name: Behavioral Economics
description: Examines how psychological factors influence economic decision-making, including topics such as biases, heuristics, and framing effects

name: Health Economics
description: Studies the production, consumption, and distribution of healthcare goods and services, including topics such as healthcare policy, healthcare markets, and healthcare financing

name: Labor Economics
description: Focuses on the labor market, including topics such as wages, employment, and discrimination

name: Industrial Organization
description: Studies the behavior of firms and industries, including issues such as market structure, competition, and regulation

name: Financial Economics
description: Analyzes financial markets and the behavior of financial agents, including topics such as asset pricing, corporate finance, and risk management

name: Agricultural Economics
description: Studies the economics of agriculture and the food industry, including issues related to production, distribution, and consumption of food

name: Urban Economics
description: Examines the economic aspects of urban areas, including topics such as urban growth, housing, and transportation

name: Law and Economics
description: Applies economic principles to analyze legal issues, including topics such as contracts, property rights, and torts

name: Economic History
description: Studies the economic development of societies over time, including topics such as economic growth, technological change, and institutional evolution
